metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18241 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
fs/f2fs/segment.c in the Linux kernel before 4.13 allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and panic) by using a noflush_merge option that triggers a NULL value for a flush_cmd_control data structure. It was discovered that the f2fs filesystem implementation in the Linux kernel did not handle the noflush_merge mount option correctly. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18241` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1039-aws - 4.4.0-1039.42
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-143-generic - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-143-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2

linux-image-4.4.0-143-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2

No subscription required

notes.Note: ppisati> fixes a case in the F2FS_FS, when the fs is mounted with the 'noflush_merge' option, but support for flush coalition was introduced in: 6b4afdd794783fe515b50838aa36591e3feea990 tyhicks> The affected user base for this issue is likely small since f2fs is not the default filesystem and it is not widely used in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
